pr_title: Make deploying to Minikube effortless when not using a registry

timeline.bodyText: Should inline the determineImagePullPolicy call like the subsequent applyConfig calls do?
timeline.author: Ladicek

replies.bodyText: I must have missed it, thanks for pointing it out :)
replies.author: geoand

timeline.message: Force ImagePullPolicy to be IfNotPresent when deploying to local Kubernetes

timeline.bodyText:
I don't really get the purpose of calling kubernetesDeploy.getAsBoolean().
Whatever the reason, this needs to change, as this call is performing an actual request to kubernetes. This should never be the case when generating resources. Generated resources should be the same regardless of the if and what is the configured environment on the user side.
timeline.author: iocanel

replies.bodyText:
The idea is that the resource only changes if you are actually deploying, if you are not deploying you get what you configured.
I think it's the best compromise.
replies.author: geoand

replies.bodyText: I would rather decorate what we deploy rather than the physical generated file.
replies.author: iocanel

replies.bodyText: That sounds weird to me. -Dquarkus.kubernetes.deploy=true should, in my opinion, be the same as kubectl apply -f target/kubernetes/kubernetes.yml. Why not do this always?
replies.author: Ladicek

replies.bodyText: I agree with @Ladicek. If it's not the same thing, I think users will be very confused
replies.author: geoand

replies.bodyText:
The idea for me is to surprise users the least. With the proposed PR, users get an indicative warning message and they can inspect what was generated.
Having what is deployed different from what is generated would cause a lot of surprise I think.
replies.author: geoand

replies.bodyText: I was trying to ask, why not remove the && kubernetesDeploy.getAsBoolean() condition. What is it good for?
replies.author: Ladicek

replies.bodyText:
My idea is to only change the policy when we absolutely have to - which is only when deploying. A user may for some reason want to just generate the resources and in that case I don't see why we should change it.
It's an edge case, so I am happy to go either way
replies.author: geoand

replies.bodyText: So, in addition to "-Dquarkus.kubernetes.deploy=true should be the same as kubectl apply -f target/kubernetes/kubernetes.yml", I also believe that target/kubernetes/kubernetes.yml should be the same regardless of quarkus.kubernetes.deploy value. I know, I'm demanding :-)
replies.author: Ladicek

replies.bodyText: If that isn't possible, then I think I agree with @geoand that it's important to deploy the same thing that is on the filesystem.
replies.author: Ladicek

replies.bodyText: Well I don't think we can do everything, so we need to find a good compromise. My opinion is obviously that the current PR is the best compromise, but I am open to other ideas.
replies.author: geoand

replies.bodyText: I think that the absence of a registry is enough to trigger the desired behaviour and keeps things simple. Having, the runtime affect in any way the generated resources is going to bite us.
replies.author: iocanel

replies.bodyText: So you prefer that I remove the kubernetesDeploy.getAsBoolean() check altogether?
replies.author: geoand
